question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
An investment of $\$24,\!000$ is made in a government bond that will pay $1\%$ bi-monthly interest (meaning that the investment will increase by $1\%$ every two months). At the end of five years, what is the total number of dollars in this investment?

Express your answer to the nearest whole number.
inference:
**Solution:**

In one year there are 6 two-month periods. So, in 5 years there are $6 \times 5 = 30$ two-month periods.

The investment will increase by $1\%$ every two months, so after $30$ two-month periods, it will have increased by $1\% \times 30 = 30\%$.

This means that the total number of dollars in the investment will be $24,\!000 + 24,\!000 \times 0.30 = 24,\!000 + 7200 = 31,\!200$.

**Final Answer: $\boxed{31,\!200}$. I hope it is correct.**
ground_truth: Five years make sixty months, so interest will have been compounded 30 times. That means that the investment will have grown to $\$24,\!000 \cdot 1.01^{30} \approx \boxed{\$32,\!348}$, to the nearest dollar.
